headline.print_headline: Risks: Child’s Weight Tied to Type of Crash Injury
headline.main: Risks: Child’s Weight Tied to Type of Crash Injury

docs.lead_paragraph: A new study suggests that while heavier children are no more likely than others to be injured in car accidents, they are much more likely to hurt their arms and legs.
docs.snippet: A new study suggests that while heavier children are no more likely than others to be injured in car accidents, they are much more likely to hurt their arms and legs.

docs.abstract: An essay in the British Medical Journal argues that widespread efforts to ban nuts do more harm than good.
docs.lead_paragraph: Every parent of a school-age child has heard the warnings about nut allergies. Some schools ban nuts entirely, while others set aside special nut-free tables. Parents are often quizzed about the ingredients and preparation methods for birthday treats they send to school. One parent told me she was asked whether a clean knife used to cut brownies had ever been used to spread peanut butter.
docs.snippet: An essay in the British Medical Journal argues that widespread efforts to ban nuts do more harm than good.

headline.main: An Obesity Tax, an Anti-Abortion Sting and Belt-Tightening at Hospitals

docs.lead_paragraph: Health news from around the Web.
docs.snippet: Health news from around the Web.

headline.main: Would Obesity Tax Curb High-Calorie Drinks?

byline.original: By JENNIFER 8. LEE and SEWELL CHAN

docs.abstract: Also in Morning Buzz: the governor's criticism of a "Saturday Night Life" skit mocking his blindness; the shuttering of another Broadway show; and other headlines from local papers.
docs.lead_paragraph: An "obesity tax" of about 15 percent on nondiet drinks is among the taxes and fees ina $4 billion tax plan that Gov. David A. Paterson plans to introduce on Tuesday to close the now $15 billion budget deficit.
docs.snippet: Also in Morning Buzz: the governor's criticism of a "Saturday Night Life" skit mocking his blindness; the shuttering of another Broadway show; and other headlines from local papers.

headline.print_headline: Taxes and Fees To Rise $4 Billion In Budget Plan
headline.main: Taxes and Fees to Rise $4 Billion in New York Budget

byline.original: By DANNY HAKIM and JEREMY W. PETERS

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. David A. Paterson will propose levies on a range of items, from soft drinks to furs and boats, in order to help close a growing deficit.
docs.snippet: Gov. David A. Paterson will propose levies on a range of items, from soft drinks to furs and boats, in order to help close a growing deficit.
